column4: How can I get OpenOffice files to open from an smb share within Nautilus?
I'm able to open OOo files from an smb share w/in Nautilus. What happens when you try?
It opens in archive manager for .odt and .xls files prompt add and remove to offer to download another SS program.
not sure what you mean by "SS" program, but can you right click in Nautilus and choose OOo Writer/Calc from the "Open with other application ..." option?
I have tried that ... it will attempt to open the file but OpenOffice opens empty.
this only happens on smb shares?
like if you drag the file to your desktop does it open fine?
and what Ubuntu version are you on?
9.04 and if I drag it to the desktop it opens fine.
local admin account is what? a smb user or a local workstation user?
and what OS is running on the smb server?
the primary local workstation account ... the accounts it does not work with authenticate to an LDAP server and have their home directories mounted vie NFS.
So after I login to a "network" account I can open files fine in their NFS home directories but they cannot open "group" files shared via smb.
An OSX server is serving NFS, SMB, LDAP, and other stuff that is irrelevent to this issue.
unfortunately, I'm stumped too.
I am super stumped ... been searching Google for days and haven't even had a slightly off topic hit.
I can't be the only one trying to run this setup.
ubuntu workstations accessing smb shares on an OSX server? No. You can't be the only person.
matrixblue, what kills me is it works perfectly with a regular account it only fails on the network accounts ... which is what all my users will be using.
thank you for trying anyway.
sure. sorry I didn't come up with any silver bullets. In my experience, OSX server is a big headache, but I haven't touched it in years.
